revised_title: Meteorological and Health Observations in Senegambia During a Fatal Putrid Disorder
tldr: The author, J. P. Schotte, documented the weather and health conditions in Senegambia during a fatal putrid disorder outbreak. He observed the impact of tornadoes and the rainy season on the environment and people's health. Schotte also discussed the two distinct seasons in the region, the rainy and dry seasons, and their effects on the atmosphere, temperature, and overall well-being of the inhabitants.
